intro: Coussarea petiolaris, commonly known as the slender coussarea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and are borne on long pedicels. It is often found in tropical rainforests, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
